description:
good food ..


$25 for a cup of sprite, grilled pork egg noodle soup, & sleepy shrimp.
author: Mariana O.

description:
Great food, better service! Overall great experience! Thanks Thai house!

This is my go to spot for years now. Always accommodating and the food is consistently good. Staff is friendly and attentive.

Mango sticky rice is my fave!
author: James V.

description:
First time ordering delivery from here. I've never been to thier restaurant so this review is just for the food delivered. Lets start with the plus. Their curry both the yellow chicken and pumpkin curries are good. The seafood pad kee Mao is pretty good too. All their dishes are a very good generous amount. Some places only give you 30% less than what you see in the picture. Plus their delivery came on time. 

Now for the negatives. The pad see ew was very disssapointing. First I ordered beef but got chicken which isn't a big deal. The problem was the flavor. It was so bland. Ive never had pad see ew that bland before. I had the noodles broken but at lease the taste was there. Previous review had also commented on the same issue but I like to taste it myself before judging. They definitely need to enhance the flavor more. 

The pad thai and papaya salad was ok nothing wow. Definitely had better. Overall my experience was ok. Would I order again? Sure! I mean their curries are good and the seafood noodle plus for the amount you pay, they do give a good amount of food.
author: Christy V.

description:
Whenever a restaurant has Khao Soi on the menu, I order it. It's a curry based soup dish from Northern Thailand and after spending some time there - I fell in love and miss eating it terribly. Most restaurants don't even come close but man, Thai House Express does. I have also eaten their Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, Pork Belly, Baked Tofu appetizer and their delicious Lychee Sangria! Everyone should definitely try the sangria! All the food was tasty. And they mean what they say when you ask for spicy - you better be able to handle the heat. Otherwise, I highly recommend ordering it without spice.
Extremely pleased with their food, service, and location.
author: Bri T.

description:
Love the food. Everything is just delicious. Rotten waiters. We asked for jalapeños twice and they scolded us. The nerve, avoid this place and go get some pizza. I'll post pictures anyways since the papaya salad was amazing.

Did I mention nasty waiters?
author: Nathan D.

description:
The design inside is different from the other Thai restaurants. Really simple and comfortable.
The fired rice was really good! The fired dumplings? were just okay. The chicken wings were good! But my friend and I didn't like the red curry very much because we usually don't like one of them inside. 
The four stars are for the fired rice.
author: Yantong Z.

description: This place, a block away from one of the busiest intersections in the Castro, is a perfect spot for Thai food. Friendly service, quiet atmosphere, and delicious food. I've been here about 6 times, and every time I'm impressed that the food is delicious. The portions are just right: not too much, not too little. I really enjoy their pra ram (the peanut sauce, the vegetables), and noodle dishes. The curries are also a favorite of mine to order. This is a great neighborhood spot. Perfect place to bring a date, or people watch.
author: Jason P.

description: As many others have pointed out. The food isn't terrible, but the waiters are. The moment you walk in they'll mutter things to each other in some language and snicker. When you order food, its as if they're doing you a favour by taking your order, or even giving you the time of day. Its a shame, because these guys are right next to where live. It's pretty clean. But the waiters need to be fired.
author: amit s.

description: I'm so sad. I was so excited for this Pad see ew I just ordered from door dash. The noodles are all broken in pieces, feels like jelly just falling apart and it taste really sweet and has a weird after taste. Pad see ew is usually savory a little sweet with lost of flavor.  It definitely taste like fast food pad se ew. Taste really fake! King of Thai and Marnee Thai are way better and they're  the same price as this place. I feel played and not satisfied at all!
author: Nina M.

description:
Order the Khao Soi. Tastes just like it came from Chiang Mai. Plus, it's massive and cheap. 

The papaya salad was crunchy and refreshing, without an overpowering taste of fish sauce that papaya salad sometimes suffers from.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Naomi S.

description: We eat Thai at least 3x a month and this was one of the least favorite in town so far. The flavors were so concentrated and just off... the panang curry flavor wasn't classic and the meat quality was not great. Also overly greasy and overpriced. I won't order again.
author: Piper W.

description:
These negative reviews are silly -- maybe don't order Thai if you don't like spicy food...

Fast, friendly, pretty authentic, cheap, tasty and large portions.
author: Pedro K.

description: Extremely disappointed with the service today. This is one of my go to place but screw up today. First, they sat a customer that came in after me because they apparently forgot about me, then serve me food without any utensils, hello--what's wrong with you guys today? It's disappointing because no matter how good the food is, if the service is this flaw, it won't matter.
author: Kyle V.

description: This is my go-to place when I am at home and I want good Thai food delivered. This is a no-frills neighborhood restaurant with very good Thai food. Nothing fancy, but very good quality.
author: John R.

description: Great service and food ALWAYS delivers. This is my go-to comfort Thai. Delicious! Definitely recommend.
author: Michael B.

description:
3.75 round up 

Thai actually isn't my favorite Asian cuisine (put a Vietnamese menu in my hands & I'm a happy diner), but for us, Thai is easy & familiar & we agree on same three or four dishes. 

Thai House Express is located at the end of the last commercial block on Castro before it turns into a long stretch of mostly residences. 

I like the vibe here, it's comfortable, the wait staff is kind & jovial, but leave you to your food after you've ordered. 

Pad Thai, Krung Pao Beef, & Yellow Curry Chicken are our go-tos & the versions served here, though not exceptional, are solid enough to be on our rotation. I'll order Jasmine rice instead of sticky rice next time; my rice was so hard 15 minutes into dinner that it was impossible to eat even when moistened with curry or Krung Pao sauce. Do get the sweet & delicious Mint Lemonade. Everything on the menu is reasonably priced; most items are under $14.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Solid place for a weekday dinner or some takeout. Food is always delicious and the service is good. Only reason it's not 5-star for is that I find that even the "spicy" curry's and dishes aren't spicy enough for me! Given I can handle a bit of heat, it is probably more than enough for most people!
author: Aaron H.

description:
I decided to try out their Pad Kee-Mao. It took over an hour for the food to be delivered even though I'm a 5-10 minute drive away.

When the food arrived, all of the noodles were stuck together in a giant mush. The food was greasy and not very flavorful. I'm usually a huge fan of this dish but I was very unimpressed with what I received.
author: Eliot A.

description: While visiting San Francisco's I was referred to Thai house express. Don't let the name fool you, when I think of anything express I think of fast food, or something you would find in a mall. This restaurant is a sit down restaurant located on 19th and Castro. It s in a blue building on the corner. This wasn't he best Thai food I h e ever had, but it was decent. We paid $12 for the lunch special Witt came with a variety of options including a salad, soup and appetizer. You do get a good little bit of food for the price you pay. The restaurants as clean and there was ample seating.
author: Chyryry ..

description: This is one of my favorite spots to get delivery from. I love their pad see-ew it is so flavorful and delicious that I really have not tried much else except for their curry which is also very tasty.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Their staff has been very unprofessional and rude.I sit there for my pick up and I saw my food has been packed and sat on their front counter for 10 minutes and I finally approached them and asked that is it my food and this guy confirmed my name and gave it to me.And instead of being nice he was being very rude.Would never go back again.
author: Harry D.

description: The worst Tom Yum I've ever tried. It was fishy spicy oil soup. The rest of my order was alright, though I've tried better.
author: Laura W.

description: The first time I have dinner here and I get a mild food poisoning.  I say mild because I did not actually go all out (you know what I mean) did get cramps and felt bloated for hours though.  See they recently had violations for food temp and mild rodent infestation.  Giving them an extra star for improved health score.  I had a vegetarian only dinner.
author: John C.

description: Ordered delivery through Yelp and the food came hot and on time.  I ordered the dungeness crab pad thai,  Minced chicken basil and fried chicken wings.  Everything was good.  The Pad Thai was okay, I've had better.  Over all the food was good but not great.  I don't know if I'd order from here again.
author: Lennie G.

description:
I wanted to like this place more but it just wasn't all that great. I love pad thai and order it pretty frequently and i gotta say, this was just not very good pad thai. it definitely was not bad (I've also had bad pad thai), just not the best. They used angel hair pasta which was confusing to me...this made the dish kind of mushy and not very pad thai-like. My friend and I also ordered the Panang curry, which was really good actually, as was the jasmine rice. 

Just an OK meal. Not rushing back here anytime soon.
author: Ilana B.

description: This place is close to home, so I was glad when the pad thai tasted alright. Can't say it was the best, but it was worth re-ordering. Wasn't crazy about the music. It was K-poppy. But the service was good. Didn't feel forgotten and had water refilled in a timely manner. Since eating here we've ordered take out twice and haven't been disappointed. The quality seems consistent. The food is a bit sweet, but isn't a lot of Asian food? Why I'm not a big Asian food fan. Best part is the location, close to shopping on Castro, so a decent stop for a visit to The Castro.
author: Kiai K.

description: Good food when busy expect to wait so most of the time I'll order out.. if you want condiments don't forget to ask for them.
author: RICHARD J.

description: This is great go-to in the Castro. My friends and I get takeout a lot from here because it's close by, and the food is good (albeit not that consistent all the time). Sometimes the food is spicier than other days and/or is a little off, but it's still really good! My favorite is the pad thai and yellow curry with chicken. I usually don't really like chicken in my curries because I find the chicken to be hard and overcooked, but here the chicken is super soft because they actually cook it in the curry. The other noodle dishes are also good, but I always end up getting the pad thai because it's a safe go to.
author: Steph V.

description:
Budget friendly lunch menu that feels like a high class restaurant thanks to friendly staff, nice ambiance, and pretty dish presentation.

Would eat here again
author: Susie L.

description: I used to go to this place and really enjoyed it. I just ordered takeout and the pad seuw was absolutely bland. Do not get it. I was so excited and craving a good saucey noodle dish. This was NOT it. I also ordered the pao grao and pad king dishes which are naturally really flavorful dishes from all the garlic and chili and basil etc. These were not nearly as bland as the pad seuw, but still less flavorful than I've had at other restaurants... :(
author: Rene C.

description: Fantastic Thai food in the heart of the Castro. Great service, particularly fast considering how busy they get. If you're looking for familiar, yet yummy versions of the Thai dishes you love, this is the place to get it.
author: Arcady S.

description: This place wasnt quick enough to be called express. Also they will not believe you if you want it spicy - look them in the eye for a second longer and explicitly tell em! Also the papaya salad was missing a key ingredient : fish sauce. The service wasn't good at all. I felt like I was disturbing them everytime I spoke with a worker. The ambience and decor is great - unfortunately the only thing going for them. If you're searching for authentic Thai food, don't stop here
author: Navila H.

description: This place is disgusting. Smelled like swege, the food was not great and filled with drunk people! Yuck yuck yuck! I wanted to leave the moment I stepped in, but made a mistake of giving them a shot
author: Ramin A.

description:
It's been eight long years since Jamie W. and I have been to this popular Thai spot on the corner of Castro and 19th. In fact, I even referred to Jamie anonymously as "my dining companion" in that review, which shows you how long it's been. What may have caused the lengthy sabbatical was a piece of twine that he found in his dish. I was so nice back then that I still gave the proprietors four stars, even though I recounted the incident in painstaking detail. Nowadays I'm not so nice. I'm more interested in being fair which is why I felt a need to share our recent marginally disappointing experience.

Jamie was surprisingly the one who suggested our spontaneous return visit. Service felt rushed and indifferent the moment we arrived. We were seated near the window crowded between two tables for two, all four of whom were already quite settled into their meals. I tried to squeeze myself onto the banquette without incident, but it was a chore that only heightened the nervous energy of the server. Once settled in, we shared an appetizer, the $6.95 Corn Cakes which were OK but nothing more in flavor or texture with a dipping sauce of sorts made up of cucumber slices, ground peanuts and red onion (photo: http://bit.ly/1P1rMWf).

We then shared Jamie's favorite Thai dish, the $7.95 Pad Mee Kao (Drunken Noodles) with chicken, onions, carrots, chili, Chinese broccoli and basil, and I have to admit it was rather on the soupy side. No twine but no definable texture either, just a soppy affair that fell short of satisfying either of our palates (photo: http://bit.ly/1CA6b0E). Better was the $9.95 Pineapple Fried Rice just because it was comfort food of the lowest order as it was mixed with eggs, cashews, raisins, onions, carrots and chicken (photo: http://bit.ly/1CT6gOl). It was good but so was my dad's SPAM fried rice and he didn't charge me ten bucks for a heaping plate of it. There were no strings attached with this visit.

FOOD - 3 stars...Thai food with little commitment for providing distinctive flavors
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...crowding us in a corner didn't endear us to the surroundings
SERVICE - 2 stars...quite hurried and below average when it came to being responsive
TOTAL - 3 stars...close call but I'll leave it at three stars for a restaurant on a discernible decline
author: Ed U.

description: This restaurant is alright, can be better and a lot of potential, food was good thai iced tea is good  but eating the chicken wings i ordered is sticky and messy. Service was decent and the price is decent, will be coming here again yes, will i recoment it yes, just a little more smile from the service and everything will be alright:)
author: Rv Andrew V.

description:
Good for take-out--they're quick.

The spicy level "Thai spicy" is pretty spicy. I'd recommend one dish at this level and hedge the others with just regular spicy if you'd like to keep some taste buds at the end of your meal. LOL
author: Yad L.

description: Ordered from here for delivery and not only was the food not what we ordered (they did not hold the carrots and there was soy sauce on my GF dish) but literally all four of us that ate it, got sick. Definitely will not return.
author: Min M.

description: Quite possibly the worst Thai food in the whole of San Francisco. The jasmine rice was edible. The rest was not. Very disappointing.
author: Adrian J.

description: This rating for a delivered order. Got the house special fried rice, a curry, and a soup. Beware! Their curry does not come with rice. It's "a la carte", which I've never seen before from any place - Thai, Indian, Malaysian. Doesn't say anywhere on their order form to add rice to that order or anything. How can you eat curry without rice?!
author: Joe W.

description:
Thai House has been in the Castro area since I moved to SF in 1991 (they were originally in the Duboce Triangle). The servers have always been amazing and the food has always been consistent. I've branched out over the years and have never been disappointed. LOVE their Thai iced tea. I'm not much of a beef person so I can't comment on those dishes but the chicken and fish dishes have been great! 

It's a solid business in the Castro and a great place to eat by yourself or join friends. Fun at night too.
author: Rich B.

description: I try not to leave bad Yelp reviews. I figure I will let the lack of a positive review speak for itself. In this case, I just had to write. We ordered the lunch special. The soup was heavy on the onion. The mushrooms were raw. The money purses with chicken inside were a decent appetizer. This was probably the best part of the meal. The egg rolls were tasteless. The eggplant was soggy and greasy. The dish came with only a little bit of bell pepper, and the sauce was too salty. They advertise a "lunch special" for $12.50. While one expects the lunch sized portions to be a little smaller than a dinner entree, I was quite shocked at the tiny serving included in this "special", which was served in a single portion rice bowl; the size of a clenched fist. In the future, I'll take my business to restaurants that offer good food at a good value.
author: Keith G.

description: Great food and nice waiters.  I eat a lot of Thai food and feel this is one of the best quality in the city.
author: Paul A.

description: Pineapple fried rice with beef was delicious! Decor was nice and service was friendly and fast.
author: Laura T.

description: I live in the Castro and this is my favorite favorite Thai place in San Francisco. I always order the tom yum noodle soup, but have tried all of their soups and they excel in it! Their spicy is very spicy and sometimes intolerable(still love it!), depending on my day I choose very wisely, but hot is always a good bet. I also love their green curry, it's just so flavorful. I usually have take out but the family that works there is always so nice and the people are quick.
author: Crystal M.

description: Ordered through grub hub.  Absolutely the worst delivery food ever.  The rice was a gelatinous glob wrapped in plastic wrap.  The beef smelled like soured meat and tasted spoiled.  And the green curry chicken was inedible.  NEVER order from this place.
author: Jason F.

description:
Wow, just had the worst service at this restaurant.   Normally I let bad service slide, but this was just so blatantly rude and quite bizarre.

Here's a first, I was denied seating at a table because I was dining alone.  The waiter at this restaurant said all the tables at the restaurant are only for parties of four or more. I said "but the place is empty." And he said that ALL the tables in the  restaurant have already been reserved for the whole night.  It's experiences like that that really make me miss my partner who had recently passed away as its not by choice that I'm Widowed.  (What's baffling is that this was my favorite place to go to for lunch where I have been seated by myself). If this is their dinner polices, I don't think I ever want to go back there again as his cocky attitude made me feel not worthy of there patronage. 

I'm now having a New York steak down the street at Wasabe Bistro and experiencing the same nonexistent bad service that they normally give me and my friends, but today it's more tolerable because at least they serve a table for one...
author: M. C.

description:
Good price for the food you get. The stuff was friendly, fried rice was awesome. Glad I stopped by. 

And they have my favorite Tom Yum soup.
author: Michael B.

description: I can't say I am a Thai food expert - I just get Pad Thai anywhere I go.  It was good here though.  Most important to me in a shrimp pad Thai is if they overlook the shrimp. They did not, and did not skimp on the quantity.  I wish there had been more egg and peanut.  Sauce was okay but not great, not as sweet, spicy or Nutty as I prefer, but fine.Price was $12 which seems reasonable, and while I took it to go, I liked the modern hipster vibe of the interior so I would eat in if I was in the neighborhood again.
author: Karen L.

description:
The coconut soup was top tier. Fried calamari had no flavor period. Chicken with ginger was
decent. My friends noodles he thought we extremely salty. Nothing really bad, just dull, bland
and lacking any excitement.
author: Peter F.

description: This is my favorite that place in the Castro. The gra-tiem was delicious, and paired nicely with the dungeness crab pad Thai. Service was friendly and responsive.
author: Aaron M.

description:
BooYah! This place is bomb. For real Thai food- get ready for some spicy lips bc this place knows how to make it hot! 

First order of business, get the pineapple fried rice. It's got all the right fixins and a whole lotta pineapple!

The pad Thai is also pretty tasty but so is everything else. You can't go wrong with this Thai spot. Happy eating!
author: Jacob D.

description: Attitude! Attitude! Attitude! Service with an attitude even before we got the table! Those servers need major attitude adjustment if they like to stay in business in the Castro. Please Remember! There are many Thai restaurants around the block. We left because we strongly feel they don't deserve our  business!!
author: jack m.

description:
My friends and I came here because we read on Yelp that they can make the food really spicy. My friend ordered his Dish "Thai spicy" and I ordered my dish "spicy". After we ordered I had a feeling the waiter wasn't really listening so told him a second time that we were serious about having it spicy. When the food came out it was good but not spicy at all. Then when the bill came it was obvious, the waiter wrote down mild for mine and medium for my friends dish. I confronted the waiter and his response was that he was just being safe. What a joke because the menu even tells you to order 1 of 4 ways ( mild, medium, spicy or Thai spicy).
The wait staff obviously doesn't care about what the customer wants they think they know what you want.
author: Marc P.

description: I was surprised just how bad the food was that i ordered for take out. The pad thai noodles were mushy, flavor bland and over all had a taste of tomato paste. I was so disappointed that clearly the food is not the focus of this restaurant. All of the dishes seemed ill prepared. Neither of my dishes had any limes, lemongrass, peanuts or lime leaves which are part of the recipe .
author: sun s.

description: Was a nice experience. Great service, good flavor and temperature's food, good prices. Thai iced tea is amazing.
author: Pipe P.

description: Good staff , clean place , confortable seats , good food . Defiantly coming back . The pinapple chicken rice really good
author: Simon B.

description: Great dining (modern with Thai Accents), THE BEST waiters, however the Thai dishes mostly taste 'off'. This is based on my many travels to Thailand.
author: Martin N.

description: Nice vibe. Good food & good service. Lunch special trays too small, stressed out eating on them. Lol I love red curry and it was good. Tom Kah Gai soup is good... Fresh and coco-nutty!
author: L. M.

description:
Really stellar Thai food, some of the best I've ever had! Everything I've tried here has been quite tasty. The Pineapple Shrimp Red Curry though is amazing, delicious combination of sweet and savory (with a touch of spice, of course). 

Their lunch specials are especially awesome if you're there at the right time. You can get an entree alongside soup and an appetizer for around $11 (quite good for a full meal of Thai food!)
author: Reese W.

description: Great neighborhood joint that has been solidly good for many years.   Flavorful food, just the right amount of sauces, fresh and delicious.   Love ordering take out from here.
author: Scott H.

description: Don't eat here! Food is really low quality, bland (or so spicy it's inedible). Haven't eaten here in ages and thought I'd give it another try- it's just terrible.
author: Jenny K.

description: This place was just okay. Nothing special or awful about it. I've definitely had better Thai food than this place. Probably won't be back or recommended it to anyone though.
author: Reina C.

description:
I recommend this place for a casual Thai night. They have beer and wine. 

Pad kee-mao with tofu is really good.
author: Hiral P.

description: The green and yellow curry here is delicious. I order delivery and it always exceeds expectations. Tom yum noodle soup is also a great choice.
author: Emily L.

description:
Great find! Cozy location right off Castro. Authentic Thai food with a variety of selections. Service was speedy; food was excellent! I had the Thai House Beef, which came with the "chef's special sauce." It was a little spicy, but amazing, with hints of basil, lemongrass, vinegar... just perfect.

I'll be back.
author: Brian M.

description:
The beef salad was really good tonight-previous issues resolved. 
Mango sticky rice for dessert....a near perfect dining experience.
author: El B.

description: The food is standard. What makes it great, as the restaurant name suggests, is how quick your order is taken and served. Also the price point is great! I go here all the time to get something quick and cheap!
author: David T.

description: I been come to this restaurant over 10yrs now.but this place hire waiter weekend on 03-25-17 . He had  so attitude and very rude person and he alway very rude and unfriendly to me . I had let's go so many time with him and today I got there at 2:45 pm for lunch and he clearly wait until 2:55 and he came over to me and told me that lunch hour over now and I told him I was there  2:45 pm and wait for him come by and he said so (order food or get out) after we chat he said we don't need your business and he said thanks for not come back to this place .I was shocked how rude he was to me and it's too bad I would ever come back home this place again and I didn't know that Thai waiter can be so cold and so rude . I hope that the owner knew that what kind of person work for them.you should be alway nice to customers and I been alway nice and patient with them but today unbelievable this not right we should nice to each other all cost tony
author: Tony T.

description:
Just went there last night with my friend and  we had a great experience. The service was very sweet and attentive, the ambiance beautiful, and the the meal was delicious. The portions were hearty and beautifully displayed. 

The prices were very reasonable with a good selection choice. Our waiter was very sweet to wrap up what we couldn't eat. Great place to enjoy on Castro. I will come back :)
author: Anne N.

description:
Such appallingly bad service I am still kind of astonished. 

The bitchy host/server treated my group of three like criminals for arriving 5 minutes before closing. We're not in the habit of showing up at restaurants just before closing, but there is a discrepancy on Yelp which made us believe we had another 30 minutes. 

We were barked at upon arrival, forced to order before opening the menu, our requested drinks did not arrive, and the check was delivered with the food. When he wasn't serving us attitude, the server stood arms-crossed staring at the dining room with a stank face. 

This is only my third one-star review of ninety, so hopefully that serves as some indication of how truly awful this man's tone and attitude was beyond what my limited writing skills can convey.
author: Andrew D.

description: This place is SO #$%&*@^ GOOD! Seriously, it trumps all other Thai food in SF. Get the curry. I always get yellow, and the chicken literally falls apart as soon as it makes contact with the chopsticks. Super tender, super delicious. Really fast if you're looking for take-out.
author: Christine N.

description: The food itself was good. I ordered delivery through grubhub. Paid a 5 dollar "delivery fee" for 20 dollars worth of food. Delivery guy demanded a tip which I thought I had paid. I called the restaurant and they said the 5 dollar delivery charge was from grubhub and not them. Well I've ordered through grubhub at over 15 other restaurants, none of which had "delivery fees" and all of which I tipped when they arrived. Shady. Pay your delivery people or take off the delivery fee and maybe I'll consider ordering again.
author: Dan B.

description: The Panang curry was delicious. I asked for hot and it was actually spicy enough (often places will only give mild or medium). They just opened and the food was still fast and everyone was attentive.
author: Colin L.

description: This place has been around for a while now, it's just OK,  The prices are so far out compared to what you get.  I guess if you are on a strict diet it's fine but there are so many better places in The City than this one.
author: John F.

description: I live very close to this restaurant and I rarely go there and now I remember why.  Its too expensive and tonight I ordered red curry medium spicy and It is so hot its inedible.  I am starving and looking at a plate of food that is no fun to eat at all.  Don't get me wrong, I like spicy.  This is super mouth rapingly hot.  So ya.  I will try to remember to not go back for another 6 months.
author: J D.

description:
Salt.  If you like heavily salted food, then this is your kind of place.  I think the salt had salt on it. My only conclusion is that the chef has a large quantity of stock in the Morton Salt Company.  

I ordered the crispy chicken, which came as a huge pile of fried chicken pieces on a plate. The chicken was dry, indicating that it was probably fried earlier in the day and kept under heat until someone ordered it. The coating on the chicken was very salty.  I also ordered the fried rice (as recommended on the menu) which had the potential of being delicious, but it was doused in fish sauce which was all you could taste, along with more salt. I dined with two other friends and one had the Crab Pad Thai.  What arrived looked like red tuna salad with noodles and it was obvious the crab came from a can, sort of like ordering tuna tar tar and getting an opened can of Star Kist.  The other friend had the steak which was actually good.  The "secret sauce" for the steak was really tasty.

I see all the complaints about the service, and my experience was fine.  The waitress was attentive and the food arrived quickly.  I dined there a few months ago and the food was quite good at that time.  Did they get a new chef, perhaps?
author: Patrick V.

description: I've been here twice now and solid food all around. I've had the Tom Kha both times. It is excellent; flavorful and rich. Got the Gra Teim my second visit and it too had a great flavor and was a generous portion. Prices are very reasonable and location is ideal. I will say that the service was slow my second visit but the food came out quickly and very freshly cooked.
author: Matt G.

description:
I had the Beef Panang Curry and it was actually pretty good - most spots in the Castro aren't great, but this is a decent option in the area.  The portion size is good and the quality of the food is also good.

The service is friendly and attentive.
author: Ken G.

description:
Just had a late lunch there.  Always had an OK experience there before, but today the service was just bad.  First, the server who took our order said that they were completely out of white rice (and how does THAT happen in a Thai restaurant?), so we ordered brown Jasmine rice instead.  When the food came, a different server brought us both brown and white rice.  I explained that we'd ordered the brown rice as a substitute for the supposedly unavailable white rice, and she said "well, do you just want both?", so we took it.  Then the check came, with both rice orders on it, and I objected.  The original server came to the table to argue about it, saying that we were being weird and he wasn't going to take either one off the order. So, I just paid the check as is, with a tip of $0.00 added.

Rude, lousy attitude along with ineptitude.  Somebody needs to clean house there.
author: Lawrence S.

description:
My favorite lunch spot is Thai! I love their Papaya salad! It has fresh lettuce, cabbage and limey/spicy papaya mix. I usually opt to add shrimp and it's so yummy! Just don't expect to get a lot of shrimp. They usually give you 2-3 shrimps and cut them in half. 

The food is always fresh and their service is pretty fast. 

Definitely recommend this place, if you're looking for something light, fast and tasty!
author: Diana L.

description: I ordered a curry dish for delivery, and it was delivered without rice. I called them and they were adamant in saying that rice had to be ordered separately. In what alternate universe do you go and order a curry rice dish and not get rice with it?!?
author: Lloyd L.

description: I think I can honestly say that this is the best Thai food in SF.  It is also quick, friendly, and fairly cheap.  I've had Thai House Express probably 30 times and they never disappoint!
author: Bob C.

description:
I really enjoy Thai house express because of the convenience (literally a block away from home.) We frequently order from here.

We always order the same things which are so tasty and have never disappointed.
-Tom Kha Gai Soup (ask for them to make it spicy)
-Pork/chicken Pra Ram
-Pineapple Fried Rice - with Chinese sausage
-Thai House Beef (the sauce is delicious)
-Pumpkin Curry
-Pad See Ew with Beef

Yum.
author: Nawal W.

description:
Popped in with my friend for the first time the other day.  The food was good and the service was ok.

I had to flag down the waitresses for more napkins and they were preoccupied with the empty restaurant and taking their breaks.  It wasn't a big deal, but it was noticeable and enough to not get 5 stars from me.

We had the "Four-some Combination" which is Egg rolls, minced chicken pouches, fish cakes, and sleepy shrimp.  For me, I had (2!) orders of their spicy minced chicken, beef, or pork with chili, basil leaves and bell pepper (ga-prow) and it was a really good time.  I really love spicy food and this dish delivered.  I'll be getting this again for sure.

It was my first time going there and the interior is not a reflection of the exterior.  It's way nicer on the inside than the outside suggests.

I enjoyed the food and will definitely go back for more or even take-out.
author: Shaun W.

description: Always good, dependable and fast. They are our go-to place for Thai!
author: Eric K.

description:
I've been here so many times, I can't believe I didn't write a review.

The food here is always good. Flavorful. I like it. It's all the way at the top of the Castro. Tonight I had the red curry with chicken, which was yummy. Also tried one of my friend's fried chicken, which was delicious.
author: Kenson K.

description:
My first visit to this place was around 2009, and when I visited San Francisco again in 2015, I was hoping to check it out again because of how great my experience was the first time.

The second visit was just as good. I ordered Pad Thai Chicken and Red Curry Chicken, and I have to say, that of all the Thai restaurants I've visited, this may be my favorite. The Pad Thai is the best I've ever had. There's just something about the flavors of the dish that makes it unique.

Service was great, food was delicious, and if there's only one concern I would say is that the chicken portion with the Red Curry was a little small. I seem to have gotten more bamboo shoots than protein. Other than that, I would recommend this place.
author: Tim C.

description: I ordered food from this restaurant through doordash. I ordered the pineapple fried rice, pad see ew, pad tai, and sticky rice.  I will cut the point... The food is overpriced and not worth it in my opinion. I'm still burping the food and my stomach feels upset, I hope I don't get food poisoning or diarrhea. This was a learning experience I'll leave it at that.
author: Ol Dirty B.

description:
Been here a few times now, good Thai food.
They know what they are doing and do it well
Have had pad thai, spring rolls, crisp noodle and green curry dishes.
author: Mark K.

description:
4/27/13 

Most recent visit was last Saturday. This is where I go if I want Thai food in my neighborhood. They have more "authentic" flavor than Thai Chef on 18th Street, which has a overwhelming inclination on putting lots of sugar in their food.

*Tom kha gai:  Coconut milk and lime juice seasoned with ginger root and cayenne pepper create a spicy broth for this Thai-inspired soup with strips of white chicken, cilantro and mushroom. Overall it's good but could be a bit less watery.

*Yellow curry:  usually good, flavorful and spicy. My friend complained that his edition in that evening was bland and tasteless.

*Thai beef: tender and barbequed to medium, beef was marinated well. Be aware of that green chili sauce, it's hotter than wasabi.

*Gai ka prow:  Stir-fry chicken with basil. Along with Pad Thai, this is a staple of the Thai meal. Order it mild if your stomach doesn't agree with spicy food. I go for medium. Basil flavor is very opulent. Perfect to eat with jasmine rice. 

The hot tea is the same herbal tea used in Thai iced tea minus the carnation milk and sugar. It's good for mitigating the flamey tongue!

Service is alright but could be more attentive. My gai ka prow didn't come with everyone else's food so I was poking at my friends' dishes. I heard Thai House in the Castro had recently divorced from Thai House on Geary in the Tenderloin. Food has got better here and regrettably, crazy spicy there. They also have traditional dishes like pork leg stew and "Ko Soi"---noodle in curry soup. Worth a try if you're interested in real Thai fare.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Something's going on at this place.  Had I reviewed it last summer after several visits with friends in town, I would've gladly given it 5 stars back then.  But the wait staff has changed AND something peculiar is apparently happening in the kitchen too.  

On Jan 2 with a friend, ordered full dinners, including soup, appetizers and wine.  Appetizers were satisfactory.  However, dinner (Pad Kee Mao) was spiced as if meant for waking the dead -- or killing the living.  Clearly the new wait staff's limited command of English played a part here.  Unlike in the past, where the wait staff as well as the owner were keen on helping customers with "Thai hot" "Thai medium" vs "American hot" "American medium" etc, the guy we got only had stock phrases at his command.  So for safety's sake (I was not in the mood to walk out of that place with "ass fire"), we ordered "mild"...and in return we got HOT.  OK, I could survive that -- I had wine and water to wash it down.  Plus anyone can make a mistake, and neither me nor my friend were in the mood to make a stink.  We ate what we could.

Then the bill came.  I paid, and left a decent (approx 22%) tip.  We still had half full glasses of wine, so we took a bit of time to finish our drinks over pleasant chat, as we hadn't seen each other in months.  And it's at THIS point that Thai House REALLY fell, from a former 5-star to 2:  Not five minutes had passed following my giving the waiter back his check tray with the ample tip, when he came up to us -- this with our wine glasses still filled 1/3 -- "You done? Need table for other party!" he blurted.  I stood up and said, "YEAH, WE'RE DONE -- AND WON'T BE COMING BACK.  Let me give you some advice, bud, since you're CLEARLY new at waiting tables: you DO NOT rush your customers out if you plan on having them come back, AND you don't embarrass them in front of other customers"  We got up and left.

I have no idea if he understood any of what I had just said to him, but on his way back to the kitchen he grumbled and mumbled in Cantonese (yes, I do know Cantonese enunciation vs. Thai) -- no slam against Chinese waiters, btw -- I've had many delightful ones in SF.  My criticism of this young-ish guy was in his final manner toward us -- clearly unprofessional and inappropriate.  Thai House would do well to keep their eyes on this chap for corrective action, lest he costs them even more business.  Pretty sad, really.
author: Gabe K.

description: A horrible experience. Did not get my order correctly.  Server not helpful nor the management! I lived in Thailand I know better. I was very specific.!!
author: Michael P.

description: Good food good people. Quick and filling. Got the green curry it was super rich and the perfect level of spice. Came alone and the staff was super friendly making me feel at home.
author: James S.

description:
Pretty good Thai food. The environment is clean and the service is good.

The basil dishes are awesome and they don't hold back on the spice.
author: Morgan K.

description: I've only had the pad thai here, but it's amazing. A little on the sweet side. Service is good too.
author: Julia A.

description: This place definitely deserves four stars. The prices are good, their pumpkin curry is excellent and always on the menu and they have quick service. Check it out if you are looking for a Thai curry in the Castro.
author: Sean S.

description:
It was late, but I was hungry. I just wanted a big, fat dinner salad. That's all, something light, something tasty.

We went into the Thai House Express because they had exactly what I wanted:
Larb salad (marinated tofu with chili, served with onions, basil, and half a slab of cabbage) in their "special lemon dressing." Sounds pretty good, right?

Wrong.

It was served right after I had a bite of the shrimp garden roll (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/thai-house-express-san-francisco-2?userid=cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg#qKwgeiY0SrgtF65m0ixYXg, which was good; tasty). The server placed the salad plate on our table, and immediately, my date and I looked at each other, like, "what's that smell?" The table next to us even gave us a sidelong glance.

It's not me, guys, I JUST showered!

The salad reeked of a combination of dehydrated-homeless-man-pee and vomit. I'm not kidding: go ahead and order that salad with tofu and smell it for yourself.

I didn't make a fuss about it, but the server did notice that I'd barely touched the salad and didn't ask why. Speaking of servers, they were great; always kept the water glasses full and were prompt with the service. 

At least they've got that going for them.
author: Adena B.

description: The WORST Thai food I've ever eaten in my whole life. We ordered three dishes and I couldn't eat any. They were so bad, I literally took a bite of each and spit it out.
author: Jessie A.

description:
This is the best place for Thai in the Castro, and yes I've tried the others.

I tried the money bags (very fun presentation) and the green curry rice dish. Both were delicious and filling. 

The restaurant itself is somewhat trendy but still very casual and friendly. I look forward to some more meals there.
author: Andrew H.

description: I have tried so many Thai places but non are as consistently good as this one. I look forward to having dinner or takeout there now more than any other food around.
author: Francisco V.

description:
I enjoyed the laid-back vibe of this place, which worked out well, in my attempt to catch up on some work here in the early evening - before yoga.  The staff were also quick to seat me, as well as to take my order. Unfortunately I was more impressed with the mellow atmosphere than with my dish.

I ended up ordering the salmon dish with vegetables and red curry sauce. I asked the waiter if the fish was grilled. He assured me that it was. He also said that he'd put less sauce on the fish. I was a little disappointed when the dish came out and the salmon had some sort of fried batter on it and the dish was swimming in the sauce. I tried to remove the some of the batter off and eat it - but I wasn't all that impressed with the actual quality of the salmon. Since I was in a rush, I decided it was a sign that I was supposed to eat light, and I just stuck to the vegetables. I have to admit that the red curry sauce was very flavorful (though to tell you the truth  - I've never had a Thai curry sauce that I didn't like) The staff were prompt at bringing the bill, but they didn't seem too concerned that the main portion of my dish was primarily left untouched. 

Judging by the sauce in my dish, and seeing what other tables' ordered looked like - I am sure that Thai House Express has some superb dishes. I would just avoid their salmon dish if you're looking for a lighter fish dish - and if you do have any specific allergies or food requests - I would definitely make sure that you really emphasize the importance of it - to their staff.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I specifically asked the hostess if two separate dishes had fish suce one she told me no and the other she said it was already pre made. It turns out after speaking with friends and researching every Thai dish this dish in particular what I had was indeed made with fish sauce. I was lied to.
author: Lare N.

description:
Great value, vast selection and good service. I'll definitely come back if I'm ever in San Francisco! 

My wife had pineapple rice and I had spicy rice noodles. As an appetizer we had a sample platter which was quite diverse and rich in flavor. 

We didn't have desert so I can't really speak on that.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Out of the three Thai restaurants in the Castro, Thai House Express is, by far, the superior bet.

Don't expect much in the arena of decoration; it's all white formica tables, and the "art" adorning the walls are basically flyers for upcoming local events.

But, my God, the food is proper. Simple, delicious, flavorful, spicy, reasonably-priced... and a friendly staff (Momma gives me a free Thai iced tea on occasion for being a regular). 

Don't judge this place with a white glove. Just enjoy the food.
author: Nate R.

description:
Pros: accepts credit, fast service
Cons: $$ food, small portions

No one was in the restaurant when my friend and I came in around 1:00pm (probably due to the rainstorm). We were seated right away and the waitress gave us our menus and brought out waters. After our orders were taken, our food came out 5-10 minutes later. My friend got Tom Yum Kha?, and it looked like milky soup with toppings. I got the green curry rice plate with chicken and it was honestly enough to be satisfied but the portions were small. The curry was warm and had a lot of fillings, but it tasted just like coconut milk and tom yum soup base. It was good, but a little salty for me. I wish it were spicier than it actually was, given it's "1 chili" rating. Not a bad experience for a first visit, but the dim lights, the rainy day, and the salty food were big factors of the three star rating that I gave Thai Express.
author: Alex T.

description: This rest. has really gone downhill. I could see from seeing plates served before getting my dish. The quality was not as good, while the overall portion and especially ratio of meat, were greatly reduced. I had the green curry I had gotten there many times, but perhaps not for 9 months.  Somethings changed - the chef and/or attempts at cost savings? The manager saying there have been no changes was absurd;hence I'm writing. 1 star might be unfair, but I used to love this place.
author: Rich S.

description: This place does a couple of things exceptionally well: 1) Pork leg stew (kao kaa moo) 2)Basil chicken (pad ga prow)
author: Thomas N.

description: The food and service at THAI HOUSE EXPRESS has been going downhill lately and last night was the worst and final experience. Service has become totally impersonal and cold and the food was close to inedible. Everything on the Four-some Combination sampler appetizer plate tasted the same (tasteless). In addition, you would expect the same sauce and condiments that are included when each item is ordered separately to be included. Nope. The only sauces/condiments included was a skimpy dollop of sweet and sour sauce slopped down in the middle of the plate.  When I ordered the Tom Yum Goong Soup the server assured me I could get it mild to medium. The soup I was served was so spicy that I literally gagged. (I've been to Thailand and know spicy).  I literally could not eat it and flagged down another server and asked for a replacement. Oops. I should have known better as this time I got a bowl of what tasted like dishwater with soggy shrimp and absolutely no flavor. C'mon kitchen. No one ever came back to the table to see if I was happy. When the check was presented they cleared away my soup which was barely touched and acted as if that was normal. The place was nearly empty so I guess the word is spreading. Bye-bye THAI HOUSE EXPRESS.
author: Ron G.

description:
Let me cut this short. Food taste is average. Ambience is Okay. Service is horrible and staff are racist and bitchy.

Let me start this review on a positive note... (Long awkward silence) Oh, I can think of one! Good location. Now, the negative part of this review. Nothing spectacular about the food just average Thai restaurant with some improvised ingredients that stray away the taste of authentic Thai food. I should know, I'm a Asian!
We didn't wait at all to be seated but It took sometime for some to take our order.
Now the ugly part, me and my friends noticed something. The (flamer) Thai waiter who has a poorly grown goatee and mustache will only talk to White people. Didnt even come to our table to check out how's our food or refill water or ask if there's anything else we need. The best part about this is, when I asked for our dessert he (she) rolled his eyes, hurriedly clean our table and threw (literally) the napkin infront of me. Then, he apologized and gave me a fake smile. What have we done to this bitch?! The horror didn't stop from there, then he sent the bill to our table even without us asking for it. This is hours before they close. Still, I gave him a good tip. Since you cant buy class maybe he hates his job so badly and he could use some money to take some basic course on right manner. 
Good luck!
author: Ollie P.

description: We've been coming for years and although they have changed to a more limited menu recently, it's still a very great neighborhood place. Favorites of ours: pork gra pow, pad see-eww, crispy chicken with their spicy sauce, roast duck and sleepy shrimp!
author: Sharon L.

description: I used to love this restaurant, been there couple time already, but I was so so disappointed after today"s visit. The male waiter is super rude, walk away before I finish my whole sentence while I was ordering. Didn't ask me how spicy I want, didn't ask if I want it as rice plate or not. but he ask other ppl. I can't understand why he treat me like this, coz I am alone?  I am so upset with his service. I swear I will not go there anymore.
author: Acacia N.

description: This place is pretty solid. They are close to my house so they are my default Thai spot. Their curries are all solid. Their pad see ew could use a bit more sauce but you definitely can't go wrong with this place.
author: Erin W.

description:
Dropped in here for a quick noodle as it was right down the street from where I was working today.

The decor was clean and modern, quite different from any Thai restaurant I have been in. I craved some beed noodles (have to load up on carbs and protein for this weekend) and that what I got. There were three different types of beef, a stew, sliced and balls. I ordered mine with thin rice noodles. The broth was a real beef broth, one that you know they made in and cooked for hours; it was that flavorful. They also put in some fresh chinese broccoli, cilantro and spring onions.

The noodle was definitely one of the best I have tasted this year. I will be coming back often since I will working around here for the next two months.
author: Tony L.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get Tom kha gai soup. The make it very different than any of the other thai restaurants. They use purple onions and mushrooms. The soup is great with steamed rice mixed in.
author: Paul D.

description: Solid Thai food. Wanted some quick take out, I'd go here again.
author: Scott H.

description:
We get take out all the time from here, because we live just around the corner. It's always great. My go to is always the tom kha soup with chicken. Delicious coconut based soup, and I always get to eat all the mushrooms because my bff hates mushrooms. Perfectly lemony and there's hardly ever any of that sediment debris at the bottom ruining the last sips of broth. The som tom salad is also delightful. They even add little shrimps to the top of the papaya slivers. We asked for spicy, but I think they think we can't handle it so it was more like medium. The service was great and they were super attentive and the place is sparkling clean and everything is white. The Pad Sew yew noodles were FUCKING COOKED PERFECT, but the sauce needed a little something extra. Now for the fun part.

I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to break up with someone in a public place. For one, you'll enjoy your meal, and for two the soundtrack will be epic. They play the most horrendous music by female artists of the late 90's. And not the good kind, or even the popular run of the mill Shawn Colvin or Meredith Brooks variety either. It's just depressing as fuck one hit wonders that you forgot all about. Please take your partners here and break up with them and they'll never forget that one song they heard that one time when they were watching Vh-1's Pop Up video back in '99.  And they'll always think of you when they hear Kelly Clarkson's "A moment Like This."
author: Vanessa B.

description: I have to admit, my number one reason for frequenting Thai House Express is its close proximity to my home. However, I would definitely recommend this restaurant because the service is efficient and the food is great. Both our sit-in and take-out experiences have been fantastic. I would definitely recommend the shrimp and pineapple curry to anyone who is looking to try something new!
author: Sophia A.

description:
Loved it!
The service couldn't have been any better.  They also gave me a Thai Iced Tea on the house after realizing that my mouth was on fire from the spicy dish that I ordered.
(I went through 4 napkins blowing my nose and loved every bite of my dinner.)

PAD KEE-MAO (DRUNKEN NOODLES)  $ 7.95
Pan-fried rice noodles with your choice of beef, pork or chicken, onions, chili, Chinese broccoli and basil leaves.

I asked for this dish to be cooked medium spicy--next time I'll ask for it to be cooked mildly spicy.

We also tried the:
 PAD SEE-EW  $ 7.95
Pan-fried rice noodles with your choice of beef, pork or chicken, egg and Chinese broccoli.

This too was very flavorful and quite mild.  We really enjoyed the flat rice noodles in this dish.

The serving sizes were generous.
 We started off with the sampler platter:
FOUR-SOME COMBINATION .$ 9.95
Egg rolls, minced chicken pouches, fish cakes, and sleepy shrimp. A great sampler! (2 pieces each)

We'll skip this platter the next time --everything was fried and it was too much food when combined with our other dishes.

The SINGHA BEER -$ 4.50 was a nice beverage to wash everything down with.  It is a very mild and light, tasty beer,
author: Thomas D.

description: Disappointing quality of food. There are better places to eat in the Castro. The atmosphere is cold. It's trying, but it's not successful in what it's trying to be. I would not eat here again.
author: David H.

description:
Friendly wait staff and tasty food. I had the best calamari I ever had in an Asian restaurant. It was sauteed with garlic and sliced for easy eating. 
The green tea was good, The chutney was tasty and not overly hot.
Great view of the activity on Castro Street.
author: Robert B.

description:
The house soup they serve with lunch is yummy. Nice Flavors and temperature is hot. Would go back just to have that. Fish cake was salty, rice was not fresh. (Peeve) I need to eat fresh food. Sukiyaki dry was contaminated with artificial seafood and way too salty. Curry pineapple shrimp was pretty decent. 

Not mind blowing, but will give you a quick Thai fix...
author: mui d.

description: Favorite Castro spot for vegan pad thai! (Ask for extra veggies or tofu, no egg and no fish sauce)
author: Yelp R.

description:
I had my first pork belly at this place last week:  fried pork belly with spicey green beans. It was exceptionally delicious. I have no prior pork belly experience with which I might compare it but what I had was awesome and also, imho, inexpensive.

My date ordered soup and the chicken pad thai. I wish I could write the exact soup he had: it was awesome. During his week long visit to the Bay Area, we talked each day of returning, at least to pick up a quart of the soup. As we ate our way around the city, we just never got back to Thai House. I'll be back.  And I'll order the fried pork belly with spicey green beans and get a large order of soup to go.

I tasted his pad thai and it was delicious but my pork belly entree was, hands down, the big taste winner for that meal. And the soup. I will most definitely be back. And so will he, next time he is in SF.

Our bill was just under $30.

The service was great. I am surprised to read yelp reviews that grumble about the service (except for the party that arrived five minutes before closing -- the place should have turned the party away and the waiter was wrong to blame the party when it was the restaurant who had the power to turn them away. The waiter should have directed his anger at the restaurant, not the customers).  We ate there around 7 p.m. on a Friday. We must have arrived just before its rush hour  because it was half empty when we arrived, and packed when we left.

Great food. Great prices. Great service.

I'll be back. Again and again.
author: Shaniqua A.

description: Yummy ... Yummy ... Love Thai food and I try a lot restaurant around SF .. This restaurant is more taste good and yummy .. Can't stop to eat my food all the time ...
author: Zaw Win T.

description:
We came because the wait at Anchor Oyster was at least an hour. 

Service at Thai House was great, the food however was just alright. 

We had the Papaya Salad, Tom Yum Soup, Seafood Combination Red Curry and Tofu Eggplant.

The Salad and Curry would be most enjoyable. The soup was super salty and the tofu in the eggplant had a weird taste I've never had before.
author: Earlene C.

description:
Not a bad place to stop by for lunch. 

We were actually looking for a different restaurant to eat at for lunch, only to find they were closed and doing construction. Well, hungry as heck, we found this Thai place a few doors down. Glad that we stopped and ate here.

They have lunch specials for $10.95, which is a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get! You get Tom Kha soup, and a selection of entrees (shrimp, chicken, beef, vegetarian), along with salad, rice, and egg rolls. You will definitely find yourself struggling to finish all that food because there is so much. They give it to you on a skinny dish that makes it look much smaller than it really is, so don't let it fool you!

I actually don't like coconut, but that soup was amazing. 

The service was also good! Everyone was friendly and they didn't nag us. They also didn't take our food away before we finished eating (which has happened to us before). 

They also have REALLY clean bathrooms for a public place/restaurant. 

Definitely would come back here again.
author: Shreya G.

description:
Food here at Thai House Express on my last visit was much better than the first time. The food is tasty. Chicken Basil (kai ka prow) is cooked in authentic way using ground chicken rather than sliced chicken breast. Crispy catfish fillet with green beans is pretty good if you feel like seafood. 

We ordered mild for Som Tum (papaya salad) and thought we could have upped the spicy level one notch to medium. Mild is just too mild for us. 

Fast and friendly service from the Thai staff. We're seated right away on a Friday night when Frameline festival is going on. Very lucky indeed!
author: Saran R.

description:
I like spice and forgot to ask to make mine a little on the spicier side, but the curry dish still delivered a nice pungent kick.    

The sig-oth had a chicken rama type of dish, but it wasn't called chicken rama.  It had a peanut sauce which was rich, creamy and flavorful.

Fast, friendly service by native Thai staff.  The restaurant wasn't crowded when we got there, but it started to fill up and I can see that it could be a little tight.  I hate when tables are so close together that you can smell your neighbor's breath, but being a small place, they don't have much of a choice. 

Just do what we do and try to go out to eat in the "off hours".
author: Just Me ..

description: Understand to the Thais....medium spice is actually SUPER spicy. Next time say " mild". Otherwise dinner was enjoyable... Liked dungeness crab Pad Thai.
author: Edgar M.

description:
Came here for lunch, had the papaya salad, soup and curry fried rice.

I've always loved the papaya salads at thai restaurants, this one didn't disappoint. The soup wasn't amazing but wasn't terrible either. Now as for the curry fried rice, i loved it, it had a lot of flavor. I would come back for the fried rice for sure.
author: Darnell L.

description:
Delicious, affordable, authentic Thai cuisine. Great customer service. I especially enjoyed the Salmon wrapped in banana leaves served with a cilantro dipping sauce.

Good to come with a larger party so you can try a lot of different dishes!
author: Alysha K.

description:
So I was out with friends and they convinced me to try this place again. I should've known better.

Once again, cold windy day and the back section was "closed". Really? Are you that lazy that you can't walk to the back of the restaurant to wait on your customers?

So we managed to get a table that wasn't right in front of the door (after they tried to sit us right in front of the door) and we ordered our food. Well they brought out everyone's food but mine. So I sat. And waited. And waited some more. And some more.

I was curious to see just how long it would take before someone checked on our table. Turns out it took long enough for all of my friends to finish eating their entire meal. Then the server stops by and asks how our meal was. I look at him and said, "well if I had actually gotten my meal I might be able to answer that".

He then apologized, asked me what I had ordered and then rushed it through. There was no offer to comp my beer or my meal. There was just a bunch of half-hearted "so sorries".

Guess what, I'm sorry that I'll never step inside your restaurant again.
author: Will N.

description: This place is popular and consistent. Food is well prepared and staff is quick and attentive. I can say I frequent this place enough because there are so many options I can eat here. Unfortunately, today they are out do the crispy pork belly I love. So it's four stars because it's quite a disappointment today. But this should not stop you from checking this place out.
author: Ray A.

description:
I'm Asian and I grew up with a friend who was Thai.  I know good asian food and Thai Express did not deliver.  The restaurant is nice inside, service is prompt. We were there for a late lunch on Saturday.

With that said, Kevin got the Spicy Catfish with veggies and I got the Crispy Tofu with Peanut Sauce.  I want to say it was because of the things we ordered, but I know it's not.  Like most asian restaurants, they have a long list of menu items, but they all share either the same protein, veggies, or sauce just in different combinations for cooked differently. Kevin's catfish dish was sooooo oily and the pieces of catfish were skimpy.  My crispy tofu tasted like it came from the asian supermarket, in the section where they have pre-deep-fried tofu cubes in packages ready to take home. I was expecting fresh super crispy tofu skin with a silky tofu center.  The peanut sauce wasn't horrible but it was so heavy. I think it may have been made with 90% peanut butter. Sigh*
author: Annie D.

description:
Some reviewers have been kind about the service but frankly even the service doesn't cut it!

They 'used' to serve decent Thai food and was a good local place  - better than other two Thai restaurants in the hood.  Sadly everything has gone down hill over the past two years.--- revamped menu with higher prices, lower quality of food ( and I mean real LOW) and service that doesn't deserve rating.  

The only 'fresh' ingredient left in this place is the lettuce, cucumber and tomato garnish on the side of the plate.  Every plate is greasy, salty, and food is just piled on a plate.   

If negative ratings were available I would rate it as -5.
Owners need to visit some real Thai restaurants in the City to learn about how wonderful, fresh and tasty Thai food should be.
author: changiz k.

description: If I could give a lower than 1 star review I would!!!  Calamari was WAY over breaded, the jerky appetizer was disgusting.  Sticky rice was actually hard in the middle.  Seriously bad wait staff.  I wonder how they call themselves Thai Food ???,
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Had the Beef Panang with rice and a side of peanut sauce, its really flavorful and savory. Also had a Beef Pad-Se-Ew which was just okay, tasted like it was lacking flavor.  

The service was really nice and they came around to see how we were doing and refilled our waters throughout dinner. 

Theres nothing too "GREAT" about this place though, the atmosphere was dimmed and it felt cold and empty. 
3 stars for good service and good Beef Panang.
author: Huy L.

description:
Thai House Express is my favorite Thai in the city.  It's a regular go-to for take out.  My friends and I really love the Crispy Chicken, Corn Cakes, Sauteed String Beans, Pineapple Fried Rice, and Green Papaya Salad.

The service is quick and friendly.   Conveniently located at 19th and Castro, there's always something pleasing to eyes as well as the palate.
author: Mike B.

description: Servers are just rude. They also constantly fail to listen. Overcooked what I told them not to. Dishes came out randomly. 10 minute wait between dinner dishes.
author: Mike O.

description:
What is wrong with these people?!?! 
4 people come for dinner. Order food. TWO people ask for TO GO boxes. Server says, "OK". Leaves with food.... 20 minutes later after we get our bill and our table has been cleared I approach the counter. "Hi. Where is our TOGO box ?"  Server swears he has NO IDEA what I am talking about. I say, "well 20 minutes ago 2 people at my table asked for a TOGO Box and YOU agreed by saying, "OK" and left....and now there is NO TOGO box ...
He looks at me as if I am delusional and says, "NO". I repeat, 2 of us asked you for a TOGO box and you agreed and said, "OK".  
He still looks at me like I am crazy. All the other servers are behind the counter with him and all look at me as if I am crazy also. BTW the 4 people that were at my table all agree that we heard him say, "OK" and take our food "TOGO". 

So when you eat here, please finish your food because God forbid you want any of it TOGO. That won't happen. Thanks for the great experience Thai House.  What a waste of Money.  Your servers Suck.
author: Rachel G.

description:
This is a quaint little place on the corner at the Castro. It's not pushed into all the hubbub of the Castro, and it might be something you miss. 

I came here with 3 other girl friends on a spontaneous dinner trip. As we walked in, it was confusing whether we were to seat ourselves or not, but a waiter from behind a counter bluntly asked us how many were in our party and waved us to a vague area. 

My first and last impression of this waiter was that he was rude and annoyed, like he didn't want to be at work at all.  When I received a plate that was slightly dirty, he picked it up and rudely asked what was wrong with it, annoyed that I had asked at all. 

There was another waiter though, who was much more likable. He was friendly and enthusiastic, and came to refill our water very often. 

The ambiance was a little cold, with white walls and windows all around showing the fog, but it was warm and comfortable inside. There is half-booth seating parallel to the wall, a large wooden table for a large group, and smaller tables that litter the back area. The restrooms are placed in the back, up some stairs, but is very clean, I was impressed.

The food was amazing, but that could have been because we were hungry/starving. The portions, though were ENORMOUS, about 1.5 x more than I would have eaten. (Then again, the three of us all shared three large plates, so they might have been generous because they knew we were sharing.) 

Anyways, we ordered a beef Pad See Ew, a Pad Thai (noted as the best Pad Thai in town by the Bay Guardian), and a Gow Se-mee. 
The beef Pad See Ew was good, but it looked like there was more beef and broccoli than anything else. The Pad Thai was delicious, and the Gow Se-Mee was my favorite. The gravy wasn't too thick or viscous, and I loved the texture of the noodles. 

In addition, my friends ordered Thai ice teas, which they slurped down with gusto. They would've ordered more if it was less expensive for a cup. 

For dessert, there are a lot of choices, including Fried Banana, but we ordered one that was on a flier in the restaurant: Sweet Rice with Mango. I was expecting some sweet rice with mango pudding or sauce on top, but they came out with a plate with actual mango pieces, which was good. The sweet rice had some coconut sauce on top, which we asked for more of (which was probably a mistake, because the extra sauce wasn't milky and sweet like the original). 

The prices were as follows: Pad See Ew, $7.95; Pad Thai, $8.95; and Gow Se-Mee, $7.95, which was pretty affordable. The Thai ice teas were $3 each, and the dessert was about $6.25. The whole dinner came out to be ~$40, which was pretty good, and we had a whole box of leftovers.

Overall, the food is great, but the service could be improved.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Tom Yum soup on-target and chock-full of stuff.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: I liked eating here. I always got either the chicken or pork fried rice. The portions were always good I never felt hungry afterwards. The staff are really nice people. This place would be nice for a cute date night that's casual. The inside ambiance is calming. Check it out if you're in Castro.
author: Krishna V.

description: Best Thai take out in this part of town. Duck Curry is like whoaaaa!!!
author: Joe B.

description: Had a bad experience there last night.  We did take out and the chicken was dried out and tasted like it was cooked days ago.  The duck was fatty and tough -- we threw it out.  I think that there are many restaurants in the neighborhood that do a better job.
author: laurel t.

description:
5 stars because after a whole day of going unnoticed in the gayborhood, a gay male patron here befriended my dining companion, noticed me (aw!), and declared he loved my cleavage.  

First of all, THANK YOU!!

Second of all, my cleavage, lol.  Yeah right.  But Castro THX, I'll love you for this, you're guilty by association of stroking my ego so hard, honey.

Lastly, it's still THX, still awesome, and especially great service here.  Keep it up.
author: Keeks K.

description:
it's quite pricy but the place is very trendy and nice, close to castro center.
some people of the staff have a terrible accent so it was sometimes complicated to understand each other when we ordered but they are doing their best.
I had curry with beef and it was delicious. don't forget to get some rice aside for the curry soup :)
author: Andrea C.

description: Have gone here for years. Castro Crowd is nice to cruise. Entrees can be hit or miss. The thin, mediocre sauces used over entrees are watery, resulting in a soggy dish. Love fried tofu but when I eat this restaurant's version,  I get painful gas. Not attractive. Curries, appetizers, soups are all good. Like I mentioned, the entrees can be hit or miss. Friendly service. Attractive staff. Nice vibe throughout the place no matter where you get seated.
author: Charlie T.

description:
Authentic and delicious Thai food.  I've not been able to find a good Thai restaurant where we live.  When I'm in San Francisco I always make sure I go to this Thai restaurant.  

We ordered the pumpkin curry with beef.  The curry was flavorful and had just enough sweetness and savory note that blended really well.  The Crab pad thai was cook just right.  The noodles were cooked perfectly, the meat was abundant and the sweetness and spice were just the right amount.  The green papaya salad, we ordered spicy, was fresh and crisp.  My favorite the basil chicken - it was cooked with just enough basil to taste and the spice level was just enough to taste but not to burn the tongue.
author: Rox P.

description:
My husband and I were in San Francisco and decided to head down to the Castro.  This was one of the few times that we didn't use Yelp to find a place to eat, but rather ask a friend what they might suggest.  First thing out of their mouth was Thai House on 19th and Castro.

As it turns out, our friends gave a great lead!  The restaurant is located on the corner and is easy to find.  Walked in and within 10 minutes of arriving, we had some delicious food on the table (which was a good thing, since it was past 2pm and neither of us had eaten yet!).  Since this was our first time to Thai House, we stuck with the basics, Pad Thai and Pineapple Fried Rice and we were not disappointed.  

Next time we visit San Fran, I am sure we will be back and will now feel comfortable to explore the menu.  If a restaurant can deliver on the basics, then I have more confidence that they can live up to the standard on the rest of their menu!
author: Scott J.

description:
Wonderful service. 

My favorite server, Golf, is awesome. Always accommodating, always friendly, and always helpful in finding something new on the menu for me to try.

Great Food.

If you haven't already, try the:
- Coconut Chicken Soup (Tom Kha Gai)
- Pumpkin Curry
and
- Pork Leg Stew (Ka Moo)

They do these dishes up right. Especially the stewed pork leg. Melts in your mouth.

Nothing but good experiences here.
author: Trevor H.

description:
This place is a great cheap eat. Don't go trying to be all fancy when you go here, this is not how they excel. Well, you can go all fancy on their "Money Bags" appetizer which I love. Their soups, curries and noodle dishes have not disappointed, and they are nice for the low/no gluten folks with rice dishes and rice noodles :) I've had no issues with to-go or take out, and had pleasant meals here with friends and solo. 

Also, do you think you all are culturally aware when you speak badly about the servers? There's things that are a little off, but not out of lack of desire to serve you but language/cultural differences. In my opinion.
author: Sarah X.

description:
Something bad happened to this place. New waitresses, unfamiliar faces.  Our usual pineapple fried rice was not up to par. It was all pineapple and raisins and barely any rice. In the past we always got Chinese sausage as a substitute for the pork and tonight our waitress looked at us completely perplexed. We got charged an extra $2.00 when it should come with a meat. The Beef noodle soup which I ordered to go had beef that was super tough.  Not sure if they did that on purpose because we inquired about the  sausage charge. Then they forgot to give us our leftovers. Seriously? 

I'm so disappointed, we asked if there was new management and they said no, but so many unfamiliar faces. And their customer service is so poor when confronted with a question about the bill. They would rather lose a customer who has dined there for years. Bizarre and just sad.
author: Flo H.

description: Everything was way too salty and the beef in one of the dishes was over cooked and tough. The place is conveniently located and you probably won't need to wait to be seated, but that should tell you something.
author: Derek S.

description:
I have eaten here twice. Both times I tried different items. The food is very good. . The prices are pretty reasonable, and the portions are generous. 

The service could be friendlier and quicker.
author: Michael E.

description:
The only place to go for to-go Thai in the Castro!  I've been a regular for a few years now and I love everything on the menu (well, everything that isn't fried-- a boy has to watch his figure!).

All the curry dishes here are fantastic, and an "a la carte" order with a side of rice is enough to satisfy a small elephant.  So couples, bicker over something else and agree on any one item on their menu if you don't want three nights of leftovers.  Besides, this strategy usually feeds two for less than $15!

The silver medalist here is their yellow chicken curry with extra potatoes, and the grand prize winner is (drumroll please....) pra ram with extra peanut sauce!  The most recent data shows that, upon first bite, this dish saves 3 of 4 couples from domestic disputes and tweens from severe bouts of depression.  No, but seriously, it's fantastic.

If you want great Thai food and decent service without Osha Thai prices, hop on over to Thai House Express!
author: Brendan S.

description:
I came here for the first time this passed Friday with my partner and a group of friends. The atmosphere was pretty nice. The restaurant itself is outfitted on the bottom floor of an older San Francisco home in the Castro, thus, it's a bit on the narrower side and the tables are small. Luckily there was a table big enough for our party of 5, but anything more than that would've been an issue. The restaurant itself is modern with beautiful hardwood floors and large windows that let in lots of natural light. Despite being located in the Castro, the ambience was on the quieter-end. Our group was able to hold dinner conversation with no problems with noise or volume.

The servers were friendly enough, although, they didn't seem particularly attentive. For example, when one of the servers came to refill water, he noticeably missed a few of the glasses despite the fact that they were half-empty. Also, it took several attempts for us to get their attention even though we were seated right in front of the register.
